I want to start by saying that this game has a learning curve but once you get past that it is loads of fun, playing killer requires know how and a bit of game sense but its extremely rewarding. If you enjoy Player versus player games then this is the game for you. Creepy, thrilling and fun.

Very fun game to play with friends, not so much on your own (Unless you enjoy killer that is). Hitboxes are a little goofy but I still very much enjoy playing the game. The game has a large selection of killers if you enjoy that or perks that will suit your playstyle or needs. I haven't encountered any bugs thus far and hackers are almost nonexistent since from what I know hackers are heavily punished and somewhat easy to detect. I'd give it an 8/10

It is a fun game and very goof for its type of game. Not many games can pull off paid DLC as in game content without a lot of backlash but this game does, with a lot of good DLC as well. They also managed to get iconic killers and survivors in which are licensed, but do not feel shoehorned or just for the money. The community requires some management with the killers however. The game as a killer cannot be rlly won without camping, tunneling or slugging while if they do not, they then lose. Other than this, overall great game
Esta muy bueno el juego, lo unico que no me gusta es que tarde mucho en encontrar partida al menos que si estas con amigos

Es un buen juego, apesar de los bugs, el tiempo de espera en buscar partida como asesino y el emparejamiento muy desorientado, creo que puede ser bueno para pasarla con amigos, ya sea jugando bien oh siendo trolls. 


It is a good game, despite the bugs, the waiting time to look for a game as a murderer and a very disoriented match, I think it can be good to spend it with friends, either playing well or being trolls.

Vorallem k√ºmmern sich die Macher auch regelm√§√üig um Bug- und Glitch ausnutzung und dazu gibt es zum Teil auch immer wieder neue Skins.

I bought this game back during year one and didn't really play too much of it because I didn't have anyone to play with.  I can't really remember what prompted me to pick it up a couple of years later, but I'm INCREDIBLY glad that I did.  I would say that at least 210 of the 220 hours I've played have come from me playing the past couple of months, and while I STILL don't very often play with friends, this is one of the few asymmetric multiplayer games where I don't mind playing with random people.  The community CAN be a little toxic, but if you look for a community outside of the randos you queue in with, it's very easy to avoid that.

El juego es recomendable, si y solo si se entiende que no es como otros juegos, la reglas "morales y eticas" no son las mismas. Campear se puede ver mal, pero los desarroyadores hicieron el juego ara que se campee cuando uno quiera. Si aguantas a los rancios y no te importa tener muchas malas partidas con gente try harder que no entiende que no es un juego competitivo, y no te importan los bugs que tenga cada temporada... pues es un buen juego xD

[b] Great game [/b], but with so many bugs. The creators try to make the killers so easy, either by buffing or creating new overpowered killers ( [i] nemesis [/i] ) . But I love this game, even though it's still about the same thing. üëç You will love this game until you will meet some facecamper / tunneler.

this is easily the least beginner friendly game i have ever played.

do NOT buy this game if you:
-easily get mad
-have anxiety issues
-want to jump into a new game quickly and have fun
-do not want to get addicted to a game
-are afraid of having to refund a game

you likely won't have fun for [b] at least [/b] the first 50 hours of gameplay, as the matchmaking system has little to no correlation to skill and often matches newer players with veterans. if you are willing to put a large amount of time learning the mechanics of the game, whether it's through youtube or actual gameplay, before playing for fun, then i may recommend this game to you. otherwise, you will regret buying it.
one more note: the devs often put terrible systems/changes into the game and may make the game near unplayable for days, possibly weeks at a time. i do have to give it to them that they have been getting better at realizing their mistakes, but know that they are VERY far from perfect.


gameplay: 0/10-4/10 depending on how buggy the game is and your luck with maps/matchmaking--you will need A LOT of patience to not get incredibly angry, and the game is often boring because about 2/3 games are you rolling the opposite side or getting rolled

graphics: 2/10 low is the only "viable" way to play since everything gets significantly darker at higher graphics settings, and ultra doesn't even look very good

audio: 0/10-6/10 depending on how buggy the game currently is (updates commonly make survivors completely silent, the killers' heartbeat way too quiet, break sound occlusion, etc.)

performance: 1/10 actual garbage for how poor the graphics are; certain things (generators, fire barrels, etc.) will make your fps tank if you don't have a really good pc--also you have to go into the config files to change the 60 fps cap

overall 2/10 due to how unbelievably inconsistent the gameplay and general playability is without even getting into my problems with game balance

UPDATE (July 2021): the matchmaking system has been somewhat improved, though it seems that playing with friends still breaks matchmaking. i (usually) get fair matches while playing solo survivor and killer, but that completely goes down the drain while playing in a SWF and the matchmaking seems random again.
most of the balancing issues (mostly the lack of counterplay to certain killers and poor map design) and performance issues still remain, so i still do not recommend this game and most of what i said previously still stands.
